reporting-org.narrative: Bundesministerium für wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung (BMZ)
Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

title.narrative: IOM Phase IV "Contribute to the economic recovery of Iraq through employment creation and revitalization of local econom
IOM Phase IV "Wirtschaftlicher Wiederaufbau durch Beschäftigung und Wiederbelebung der lokalen Wirtschaft" (VPT)

description.narrative: In continuation of Phase I (BMZ No. 2018 49 587), Phase II (BMZ No. 2019 40 741) and Phase III (BMZ No. 2020 40 533) Phase IV will be undertaken through a combined approach that will offer beneficiaries both longer-term livelihoods support via sustainable job opportunities and employability enhancement, as well as shorter-term economic income assistance to buttress the financial security of the most vulnerable individuals. The target group will comprise of internally displaced persons (IDPs) who have set up a living in other than their area of origin, IDPs who have returned to their areas of origin, vulnerable members of the host communities as well as returnees from abroad to Iraq. The Cash-for-Work (CfW) programme will provide short-term financial assistance to 2,755 individuals with the aim of alleviating poverty and/or debt among the most vulnerable beneficiaries and their families. Under the interventions designed for longer-term economic impact, IOM will carry out the following: 1) build the capacities of vulnerable households through the delivery of individual livelihoods support to 2,920 individuals by means of vocational trainings (VT), on-the-job trainings (OJT), and assistance in beginning or expanding micro-enterprises, 2) promote an enabling environment for businesses to re-open and stimulate job creation through the rehabilitation of 21 economic- and market-related infrastructures, and 3) provide or facilitate economic opportunities for market actors by supporting 425 small and medium enterprises (SMEs) via the Enterprise Development Fund (EDF), allowing for the creation of 2,000 sustainable jobs. The Project Duration is 48 months with a total cost volume of EUR 30 mio.
Schaffung von Möglichkeiten zur Generierung von Einkommen für Iraker und Verbesserung der Arbeitsfähigkeit

In continuation of Phase I (BMZ No. 2018 49 587), Phase II (BMZ No. 2019 40 741) and Phase III (BMZ No. 2020 40 533) Phase IV will be undertaken through a combined approach that will offer beneficiaries both longer-term livelihoods support via sustainable job opportunities and employability enhancement, as well as shorter-term economic income assistance to buttress the financial security of the most vulnerable individuals. The target group will comprise of internally displaced persons (IDPs) who have set up a living in other than their area of origin, IDPs who have returned to their areas of origin, vulnerable members of the host communities as well as returnees from abroad to Iraq. The Cash-for-Work (CfW) programme will provide short-term financial assistance to 2,755 individuals with the aim of alleviating poverty and/or debt among the most vulnerable beneficiaries and their families. Under the interventions designed for longer-term economic impact, IOM will carry out the following: 1) build the capacities of vulnerable households through the delivery of individual livelihoods support to 2,920 individuals by means of vocational trainings (VT), on-the-job trainings (OJT), and assistance in beginning or expanding micro-enterprises, 2) promote an enabling environment for businesses to re-open and stimulate job creation through the rehabilitation of 21 economic- and market-related infrastructures, and 3) provide or facilitate economic opportunities for market actors by supporting 425 small and medium enterprises (SMEs) via the Enterprise Development Fund (EDF), allowing for the creation of 2,000 sustainable jobs. The Project Duration is 48 months with a total cost volume of EUR 30 mio.

Ziel der FZ-Maßnahme ist es, mittel- bis langfristige Einkommensmöglichkeiten für Binnenvertriebene, Rückkehrer und bedürftige Anwohner im Irak zu schaffen. Im Mittelpunkt des Vorhabens stehen dabei Maßnahmen zur Verbesserung der Beschäftigung (Berufsbildungstraining, landwirtschaftliches Training, On-the-job Training, Jobvermittlung; Betriebs- und Unternehmenserweiterungen und Zuschüsse an KMU durch den Enterprise Development Fund). Daneben werden auch kurzfristige Beschäftigungsmaßnahmen (Cash for Work) finanziert, um kurzfristig Einkommensmöglichkeiten zu schaffen. Zudem werden wirtschaftsfördernde Infrastrukturmaßnahmen durchgeführt, um es Unternehmen zu erleichtern sich anzusiedeln und/oder zu expandieren. Gleichzeitig soll die Fähigkeit der relevanten Ministerien und Institutionen gestärkt werden, Maßnahmen zur Verbesserung der Lebensbedingungen und Beschäftigung besser zu koordinieren und auf lokaler Ebene Kleinst-, Klein- und mittlere Unternehmen (KKMU) zu unterstützen. Das Vorhaben wird durch die International Organization for Migration (lOM) umgesetzt.
